tit.cmt: 英語のタイトルのみとしました。

sen.j: 大和国（やまとのくに）は、かつて日本に設けられた地方行政区分の令制国の一つである。
sen.e: Yamato no kuni is one of the ryoseikoku (provinces) once established under the local administration system in Japan.
Yamato Province is one of the ryoseikoku (provinces) once established under the local administration system in Japan.
sen.cmt: yamato no kuni → yamato province としました。
sen.e: Yamato Province is one of the ryoseikoku (provinces) once established under the local administration system in Japan.

sen.j: 畿内に含まれ、延喜式での格は国司国等級区分。
sen.e: This province was in the Kinai region (the five capital provinces surrounding the ancient capitals of Nara and Kyoto), and was ranked as a province ruled by governor in Engishiki (codes and procedures on national rites and prayers).

This province was in the Kinai region (the five capital provinces surrounding the ancient capitals of Nara and Kyoto), and was ranked as a province ruled by governor in Engishiki (codes and procedures on national rites and prayers).

This province was in the Kinai region (the five capital provinces surrounding the ancient capitals of Nara and Kyoto), and was ranked as a province ruled by governor in Engishiki (codes and procedures on national rites and prayers).

sen.j: 領域は現在の奈良県にあたる。
sen.e: Its territory covered today's Nara Prefecture.
Its territory covered today's Nara Prefecture.
Its territory covered today's Nara Prefecture.
The province was also called Washu.
The province was also called Washu.
The province was also called Washu.

sen.j: 初めの頃は大倭と書かれ、奈良時代の天平9年から10年間大養徳と字を改めた事がある。
sen.e: Initially, it was written as "大倭" but was changed to "大養徳" for ten years from 737 during the Nara period.
Initially, it was written as "大倭" but was changed to "大養徳" for ten years from 737 during the Nara period.
Initially, it was written as "大倭" but was changed to "大養徳" for ten years from 737 during the Nara period.

sen.j: 「大和」という表記が正式に決定されるのは天平宝字2年以後とされる。
sen.e: It is said that it was in 758 or thereafter that the representation of "大和" was formally determined.
It is said that it was in 758 or thereafter that the representation of '大和' was formally determined.
It is said that it was in 758 or thereafter that the representation of '大和' was formally determined.

sen.j: 地域名としての大和は大和を参照。
sen.e: For Yamato as the regional name, see "Yamato."
For Yamato as the regional name, see "Yamato."
For Yamato as the regional name, see "Yamato."
Kokufu (Provincial Capital)
Kokufu (provincial capital)
sen.cmt: カッコ内を小文字にしました。
sen.e: Kokufu (provincial capital)

sen.j: 国府は、葛上郡掖上（現在の御所市東北部）の地にあったが、平城京遷都に伴って高市郡の軽の地（現在の橿原市大軽町と石川町の接点丈六、ここを軽の衢という）に移った。
sen.e: The provincial capital was located in Wakinokami, Katsuraginokami no koori (now the northeastern part of Gose City), but was relocated in Karu no chi, Takaichi no koori (now the Joroku intersection located on the boundary between Ogaru-cho and Ishikawa-cho in Kashihara City, which was once called " Karu no chimata") due to the relocation of the Heijokyo capital.
sen.cmt: 「葛上郡（かつらぎのかみのこおり・かつじょうぐん）は大和国にあった郡である」「橿原市石川町の丈六（じょうろく）交差点（軽の衢（かるのちまた）」
sen.e: The provincial capital was located in Wakinokami, Katsuraginokami no kori (now the northeastern part of Gose City), but was relocated in Karu no chi, Takaichi no kori (now the Joroku intersection located on the boundary between Ogaru-cho and Ishikawa-cho in Kashihara City, which was once called " Karu no chimata") due to the relocation of the Heijo-kyo capital.
sen.cmt: Koori →Kori に変更しました。Heijo-kyo としました。
sen.e: The provincial capital was located in Wakinokami, Katsuraginokami no kori (now the northeastern part of Gose City), but was relocated in Karu no chi, Takaichi no kori (now the Joroku intersection located on the boundary between Ogaru-cho and Ishikawa-cho in Kashihara City, which was once called " Karu no chimata") due to the relocation of the Heijo-kyo capital.

sen.j: 国府は数ヶ所が推定されているが不明。
sen.e: The provincial capital is unknown although several places are regarded as its possible sites.
The provincial capital is unknown although several places are regarded as its possible sites.
The provincial capital is unknown although several places are regarded as its possible sites.

sen.j: 守護所は設置されず、興福寺がその役割を果たしていた。
sen.e: Instead of the provincial government office, Kofuku-ji Temple functioned as the shugosho office.
sen.cmt: 守護所（しゅごしょ）とは、中世日本において守護が居住した館の所在地のこと。守護の政治的権限の拡大とともに政庁所在地としての機能が国衙より移されていった。
sen.e: Since no shugosho (provincial administration) office was established, Kofuku-ji Temple functioned as the office.
sen.cmt: 一部表現を変更しました。
sen.e: Since no shugosho (provincial administration) office was established, Kofuku-ji Temple functioned as the office.

sen.j: 易林本の節用集では、十市郡に府と記載ある。
sen.e: According to the Japanese dictionary written by Ekirin, the capital is located in Toichi no koori.
sen.cmt: 「平井易林が刊行」「窃用集：室町中期に成立した国語辞書」
sen.e: According to the Japanese dictionary written by Ekirin, the capital is located in Toichi no kori.
According to the Japanese dictionary written by Ekirin, the capital is located in Toichi no kori.
Ichinomiya, Kokubun-ji Temple, etc.
Ichinomiya, kokubun-ji temple, etc.
sen.cmt: タイトルのため、一部小文字としました。
sen.e: Ichinomiya, kokubun-ji temple, etc.

sen.j: 国分寺は東大寺とするのが一般的だが、橿原市の満法院とする説もある。
sen.e: Todai-ji Temple is generally regarded as the kokubun-ji temple (the provincial temple built under the orders of the Emperor), but Manpo-in Temple in Kashihara City is also said to have been the kokubun-ji temple.
sen.cmt: 「国分寺（こくぶんじ）、国分尼寺（こくぶんにじ）は、741年（天平13年）、聖武天皇が国情不安を鎮撫するため、各国に建立を命じた寺院」
sen.e: Todai-ji Temple is generally regarded as the kokubun-ji temple (the provincial temple built under the orders of the Emperor), but Manpo-in Temple in Kashihara City is also said to have been the kokubun-ji temple.

Todai-ji Temple is generally regarded as the kokubun-ji temple (the provincial temple built under the orders of the Emperor), but Manpo-in Temple in Kashihara City is also said to have been the kokubun-ji temple.

sen.j: 国分尼寺は法華寺である。
sen.e: Hokke-ji Temple is the kokubun-niji temple (the provincial nunnery temple built under the orders of the Emperor).
Hokke-ji Temple is the kokubun-niji temple (the provincial nunnery temple built under the orders of the Emperor).
Hokke-ji Temple is the kokubun-niji temple (the provincial nunnery temple built under the orders of the Emperor).

sen.j: 延喜式神名帳には大社128座（うち名神大社47座26社）・小社158座の計286座が記載されており、全て官幣社である。
sen.e: In the engishiki jimmyocho (a register of shrines in Japan), 128 gods enshrined at grand shrines (including 47 powerful myojin gods at 26 myojin grand shrines) and 158 gods at small shrines, which total to 286 gods, are recorded, and all are kanpeisha (shrines where religious ceremonies were conducted by jingikan officers).
sen.cmt: 「延喜式神名帳に記載された神社（式内社）は全国で2861社であり、そこに鎮座する神の数は3132座である」「名神大社とは、日本の律令制下において、名神祭の対象となる神々（名神）を祀る神社である。名神は神々の中で特に古来より霊験が著しいとされる神に対する称号」「官幣社は神祇官が祀る神社。主として官幣社は二十二社や天皇・皇族を祀る神社など朝廷にゆかりのある神社」を参考に翻訳。
sen.e: In the engishiki jimmyocho (a register of shrines in Japan), 128 gods enshrined at grand shrines (including 47 powerful myojin gods at 26 myojin grand shrines) and 158 gods at small shrines, which total to 286 gods, are recorded, and all are kanpeisha (shrines where religious ceremonies were conducted by jingikan officers).

In the engishiki jimmyocho (a register of shrines in Japan), 128 gods enshrined at grand shrines (including 47 powerful myojin gods at 26 myojin grand shrines) and 158 gods at small shrines, which total to 286 gods, are recorded, and all are kanpeisha (shrines where religious ceremonies were conducted by jingikan officers).

sen.j: 一宮は桜井市の大神神社だが、神社が自ら一宮を称した文書は見つかっていない。
sen.e: Ichinomiya (the highest ranking shrine) was Oomiwa Shrine in Sakurai City, but there have not been any documents that the shrine calls itself ichinomiya.
Ichinomiya (the highest ranking shrine) was Omiwa Shrine in Sakurai City, but there have not been any documents that the shrine calls itself ichinomiya.
sen.cmt: Oomiwa→ Omiwa に変更しました。
sen.e: Ichinomiya (the highest ranking shrine) was Omiwa Shrine in Sakurai City, but there have not been any documents that the shrine calls itself ichinomiya.
There are no other shrines including ninomiya (the second highest ranking shrine).
There are no other shrines including ninomiya (the second highest ranking shrine).
There are no other shrines including ninomiya (the second highest ranking shrine).

sen.j: 惣社は国府神社（奈良県高市郡高取町下土佐）。
sen.e: Soja (merged shrine) is Kokufu Shrine (Tosa, Takatori-cho Takaichi-gun, Nara Prefecture).
sen.cmt: 「惣社とは、特定地域内の神社の祭神を集めて 祀った（合祀）神社のことである」を参考に翻訳。
sen.e: Soja (merged shrine) is Kokufu Shrine (Shimotosa, Takatori-cho, Takaichi-gun, Nara Prefecture).
Soja (merged shrine) is Kokufu Shrine (Shimotosa, Takatori-cho, Takaichi-gun, Nara Prefecture).
